intro: Sida anomala f. violaceiflora, commonly known as purpleflower sida, is a variant of the annual herbaceous plant native to tropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its hairy stems and alternate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically purple or violet in color, giving it its common name. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in agricultural areas and along roadsides. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological studies and ornamental gardening.
